fields.label: Profile Completeness
fields.description: The more you fill in, the smarter your AI assistant becomes.

fields.label: Completeness
fields.description: Automatically calculated based on filled sections

fields.label: Section 1: Company Identity
fields.description: Basic information about your company. This helps the AI understand who you are and tailor responses to your context.

fields.label: Company Name (Legal)
fields.description: Your company's full legal name as registered. Example: Acme Industries Private Limited

fields.label: Trading / Brand Name
fields.description: The name your customers know you by, if different from legal name. Example: Acme Tools

fields.label: Industry
fields.options:
Manufacturing
Retail & Distribution
Services & Consulting
Trading
Agriculture & Farming
Healthcare & Pharma
Education
Construction & Real Estate
Food & Beverage
Textile & Apparel
Automotive
IT & Software
Logistics & Transport
Energy & Utilities
Other
fields.description: Select the industry that best describes your business

fields.label: Industry Detail
fields.description:
Describe your specific niche in 1-2 sentences. This is the most important field for AI accuracy.

Example: We manufacture automotive spare parts (brake pads, clutch plates) for the Indian aftermarket, selling to distributors and retail shops across South India.

fields.label: Primary Location
fields.description: Where is your main office or facility? Example: Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India

fields.label: Company Size
fields.description: Approximate number of employees

fields.label: Primary Currency
fields.description: The currency used in most of your transactions

fields.label: Financial Year Starts In
fields.description: When does your financial year begin? India: April, US: January, UK: April

fields.label: Multi-Company Setup
fields.description: If you operate multiple companies in ERPNext (e.g., one for manufacturing + one for sales)

fields.label: We use multiple companies in ERPNext
fields.description: Enable this if you have more than one Company in ERPNext and want the AI to query across all of them

fields.label: Company Details
fields.description:
List each company and its role (one per line). Example:
Acme Industries Pvt Ltd — Manufacturing, procurement
Acme Sales Pvt Ltd — Sales, distribution

IMPORTANT: When users ask about 'total sales', the AI will query ALL companies and show combined + per-company breakdown.

fields.label: Section 2: Products & Services
fields.description: What does your company sell and buy? This helps the AI understand your product catalog and supply chain.

fields.label: What You Sell
fields.description:
List your main products or services, one per line. Be specific.

Example:
- Automotive brake pads (disc and drum)
- Clutch plates and pressure plates
- Suspension bushings
- Brake shoes

fields.label: What You Buy (Raw Materials / Inputs)
fields.description:
List your main purchases or raw materials, one per line.

Example:
- Steel sheets (hot-rolled)
- Brake friction material
- Packaging cartons
- Adhesives and bonding agents

fields.label: Primary Unit of Measure
fields.description: How do you measure what you sell? Example: Kg, Pieces, Liters, Metres, Bags, Tonnes

fields.label: Pricing Model
fields.description: How do you price your products? Example: Per piece, ex-factory. Transport extra. Different price lists for different regions.

fields.label: Section 3: Sales & Customers
fields.description: How do you sell and who are your customers? This helps the AI provide relevant sales analysis.

fields.label: Sales Channels
fields.description:
How do you reach your customers? One per line.

Example:
- Direct to factories and OEMs
- Through 50+ authorized distributors
- Online orders via our website
- Export to 5 countries

fields.label: Customer Types
fields.description:
Who are your main customer categories? One per line.

Example:
- OEM manufacturers (bulk orders)
- Retail auto parts shops
- Fleet maintenance companies
- Export buyers

fields.label: Key Sales Metrics
fields.description:
What sales numbers matter most to your business? One per line.

Example:
- Monthly revenue (target vs actual)
- Revenue by territory
- Top 10 customers by revenue
- Daily sales and collections
- Average order value
- Days Sales Outstanding (DSO)

fields.label: Section 4: Operations & Production
fields.description: If you manufacture or produce goods, describe your operations here. Leave blank if you're a pure trading/services company.

fields.label: We have manufacturing / production
fields.description: Enable this if you manufacture or produce goods

fields.label: Manufacturing / Production Details
fields.description:
Briefly describe your production process, facility, and key operations.

Example:
- We operate a 50,000 sq ft facility with CNC machines
- Raw materials are cut, pressed, and heat-treated
- Quality inspection at every stage
- Batch tracking with BOM-based production

fields.label: Key Production Metrics
fields.description:
What production numbers matter? One per line.

Example:
- Work Order completion rate
- Daily production output
- Rejection / wastage rate
- Machine utilization percentage
- Raw material consumption vs plan

fields.label: Section 5: Finance & Accounting
fields.description: What financial questions do you ask most? This shapes the AI's financial analysis capabilities.

fields.label: Key Financial Questions
fields.description:
What financial information do you ask about most? One per line.

Example:
- Outstanding receivables by customer
- Monthly P&L comparison
- Cash flow status
- Vendor payment dues
- Collections vs billing
- Working capital cycle

fields.label: Typical Payment Terms
fields.description: What are your standard payment terms? Example: 30 days credit for established customers, advance payment for new customers, 2% discount for early payment.

fields.label: Financial Analysis Depth
fields.options:
Basic (revenue, expenses, profit)
Intermediate (+ ratios, DSO/DPO, aging)
Advanced (+ working capital cycle, cash conversion, benchmarks)
CFO-Level (full financial intelligence)
fields.description: How deep should the AI go with financial analysis?

fields.label: Section 6: Terminology & Language
fields.description: Custom terms, abbreviations, and language preferences. This prevents misunderstandings.

fields.label: Custom Terminology
fields.description:
Industry or company-specific terms the AI should know. One per line, format: TERM = Meaning

Example:
SKU = Stock Keeping Unit (our internal product code)
MRN = Material Receipt Note
GRN = Goods Receipt Note
SO = Sales Order
DN = Delivery Note
PE = Payment Entry

fields.label: Communication Style
fields.description: How should the AI communicate? Formal = corporate tone, Professional = business-friendly, Casual = relaxed

fields.label: Primary Language
fields.options:
English
Hindi
Tamil
Telugu
Kannada
Malayalam
Marathi
Gujarati
Bengali
Punjabi
fields.description: Primary language for AI responses

fields.label: Section 7: AI Behavior Preferences
fields.description: Fine-tune how the AI responds. These preferences apply to all users on your site.

fields.label: Default Response Length
fields.options:
Brief (2-3 sentences)
Standard (1 paragraph)
Detailed (full analysis with tables)
fields.description: How verbose should AI responses be by default?

fields.label: Number Format
fields.options:
Indian (Lakhs, Crores)
International (Millions, Billions)
Plain numbers (no abbreviation)
fields.description: How should the AI format large numbers? Indian: 12,34,567 / ₹45.23 L. International: 1,234,567 / $1.23M

fields.label: Executive Focus Areas
fields.description:
What should the AI prioritize when reporting to management? One per line.

Example:
- Revenue vs target
- Cash position and collections
- Overdue receivables
- Working capital cycle
- Production output
- Low stock items

fields.label: Restricted Data
fields.description:
Data the AI should NOT discuss with regular users. One per line.

Example:
- Individual employee salaries (unless HR Manager)
- Customer-specific pricing discounts
- Internal margin percentages (unless executive)

fields.label: AI Personality & Voice
fields.description: Optional: customize the AI's personality and communication style

fields.label: AI Personality Instructions
fields.description:
How should the AI behave? Write instructions as if you're coaching a new executive.

Example:
- Be professional but warm
- Use 'we' and 'our' when talking about the company
- Be decisive — don't hedge with 'it seems like'
- If data shows something important, say it proactively
- Recommend actions, don't just report numbers

fields.label: Example Response (Optional)
fields.description:
Paste an example of the ideal AI response. The AI will mimic this style.

Example:
Our collections this month are ₹38.4 L against ₹52.1 L in sales — that's a 73.7% collection rate, down from 81.2% last month. DSO has crept up to 47 days. I'd recommend focusing on the top 5 overdue accounts.

fields.label: Custom Doctypes Knowledge
fields.description: If you have custom doctypes in ERPNext that the AI should know about, describe them here.

fields.label: Custom Doctypes
fields.description:
Describe any custom doctypes the AI should be aware of. One per line, format:
Doctype Name — field1, field2, field3. Purpose: what this doctype tracks.

Example:
Job Card Custom — machine_id, operator, start_time, end_time. Purpose: tracks machine-level production.
Dealer Agreement — dealer, territory, commission_rate, validity. Purpose: manages dealer contracts.

fields.label: Industry Benchmarks
fields.description: Optional: provide industry benchmarks so the AI can compare your performance

fields.label: Industry Benchmarks
fields.description:
What are typical performance numbers in your industry? This helps the AI evaluate your metrics.

Example:
- Typical gross margin: 20-30%
- Typical DSO: 30-45 days
- Revenue growth: 10-15% YoY for mid-size
- Working capital cycle: 45-75 days is normal
